intro: Talauma borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean talauma, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species with limited distribution.
